citation.article-title: Salinarimonas ramus sp. nov. and Tessaracoccus oleiagri sp. nov., isolated from a crude oil-contaminated saline soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salinarimonas ramus sp. nov.
Salinarimonas ramus [ra′mus. L. n. ramus (nominative in apposition) a branch, referring the shape of the cells].
Cells are Gram-negative staining, facultatively anaerobic, straight or curved rods (0.6–4.0×1.25–25 µm) forming branches and are motile with a single polar flagellum.
Colonies grown on ASW agar are small, smooth, circular, convex and deep red in colour.
Deep red pigment is produced when cells are grown in ASW medium at 30 °C for 7 days.
The pufLM genes of the photosynthetic reaction centre can be detected.
Optimum growth occurs at 28 °C, pH 7.0 and 4 % (w/v) NaCl.

Positive for PHB production and β-galactosidase, negative for the Voges–Proskauer test and for the activities of oxidase, urease, esterase (C4), lipase (C14), arginine dihydrolase, acid phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin and for assimilation of malate, citrate and phenylacetate.
Acid is produced from l-arabinose, aesculin ferric citrate, xylitol and potassium 5-ketogluconate.

Utilizes xylose, rhamnose, dulcitol, d-fructose, succinate, d-galactose and trehalose, but not sodium citrate, d-ribose, raffinose, α-lactose, l-arabinose, d-mannitol, formate, sorbitol, inositol or benzoate as the sole carbon source.
Utilizes l-proline, but not serine, alanine, ornithine, glycine, tryptophan, l-aspartate, phenylalanine and arginine as sole nitrogen source.
Resistant to clindamycin (2 µg), polymyxin B (300 IU), vancomycin (30 µg).

Sensitive to kanamycin (30 µg), sulfamethoxazole (300 µg), streptomycin (300 µg), ceftazidime (30 µg), ofloxacin (5 µg), amoxicillin (10 µg), tetracycline (30 µg), erythromycin (15 µg), neomycin (30 µg), penicillin G (10 IU), novobiocin (5 µg) and cefotaxime (30 µg).
Other physiological and biochemical properties are given in Table 1.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and 10-methyl C19 : 0.
The predominant respiratory ubiquinone is Q-10.
The major polar lipids are DPG, PE, PG, PC, PIM, PI and PL.
The type strain, SL014B-41A4T ( = DSM 22962T = CGMCC 1.9161T), was isolated from a crude oil-polluted saline soil from the Shengli Oilfield, eastern China.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.68 mol%.
